content:
The as operator must be used with a reference type or nullable type ('int' is a non-nullable value type).

The as operator was passed a value type. Because as can return null, it can only be passed reference types or nullable type. For more information about nullable types, see Nullable Types.

The following sample generates CS0077: 

// CS0077.cs  
using System;  

class C  
{  
}  

struct S  
{  
}  

class M  
{  
   public static void Main()  
   {  
      object o1, o2;  
      C c;  
      S s;  

      o1 = new C();  
      o2 = new S();  

      s = o2 as S;  // CS0077, S is not a reference type.  
      // try the following line instead  
      // c = o1 as C;  
   }  
}
